# This Month in the DuckDB Ecosystem: November 2023

2023/11/22 - 4 min read

BY

[Marcos Ortiz](https://motherduck.com/authors/marcos-ortiz/)

## Hey, friend üëã

It‚Äôs [Marcos](https://www.linkedin.com/in/mlortiz) again, aka ‚ÄúDuckDB News Reporter‚Äù with another issue of ‚ÄúThis Month in the DuckDB Ecosystem" for November 2023.

As always, this is a two-way conversation: if you have any feedback on this newsletter, feel free to send us an email to [duckdbnews@motherduck.com](mailto:duckdbnews@motherduck.com)

![Post asset](https://motherduck.com/_next/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2F22616816.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net%2Fhubfs%2F22616816%2Fdavid-cropped-bottom-2.jpg&w=3840&q=75)

### David Gasquez

[David Gasquez](https://www.linkedin.com/in/davidgasquez/) is a data engineer at Protocol Labs.

David has done an¬†**awesome** service to the DuckDB community by creating a GitHub project to curate all the awesome DuckDB libraries, tools and resources.

Check out [**Awesome DuckDB on GitHub**](https://github.com/davidgasquez/awesome-duckdb).

You can connect with David on [GitHub](https://github.com/davidgasquez), [X](https://twitter.com/davidgasquez) or [LinkedIn.](https://www.linkedin.com/in/davidgasquez/)

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| ![Post asset](https://motherduck.com/_next/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2F22616816.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net%2Fhubfs%2F22616816%2Ftop_links_graphic.png&w=3840&q=75) | ## Top DuckDB Links this Month |

### [Summing columns in remote Parquet files using DuckDB](https://til.simonwillison.net/duckdb/remote-parquet)

[Simon Willison](https://twitter.com/simonw) is using the power of DuckDB to access remote Parquet files, hosted on Hugging Face, to work with 148 TB of image data.

### [Getting Started With DuckDB For Data Analytics In Python](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3KZyUboRwM8)

Jie Jenn provides an useful example about how to use Python and DuckDB for Data Analytics

### [Cached Takes: 80% of Companies do not need Snowflake or Databricks](https://kjhealey.medium.com/cached-takes-80-of-companies-do-not-need-snowflake-or-databricks-5ebda64c0853)

Do you really need a big data warehouse service? According to [Kieran Healy](https://www.linkedin.com/in/kieran-healey/), you can solve your problems with DuckDB.

### [Cube : Introducing DuckDB and MotherDuck integrations](https://cube.dev/blog/introducing-duckdb-and-motherduck-integrations)

The ecosystem for DuckDB is growing exponentially every single day, and this integration with Cube is a good example of it.

### [Researchers, please replace SQLite with DuckDB now](https://dirk-petersen.medium.com/researchers-please-replace-sqlite-with-duckdb-now-f038044a2702)

If you are a researcher, you need to hear this advice from [Dirk Petersen](https://www.linkedin.com/in/dirkpetersen/): move to DuckDB now and enjoy the benefits.

### [Spark, Dask, DuckDB, Polars: TPC-H Benchmarks at Scale](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wKH0-zs2g_U)

This is a very interesting benchmark conducted by [Matthew Rocklin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/mrocklin/)

### [Create DuckDB Connection and Dataset using Delta Lake Parquet File in Apache Superset](https://medium.com/@syarifz.id/create-duckdb-connection-and-create-dataset-using-parquet-file-in-apache-superset-8765e5772342)

If you were waiting for a signal to combine Apache Superset and DuckDB, this is it.

### [Harnessing in-process analytics for data science and beyond](https://szarnyasg.github.io/talks/oredev2023-duckdb.pdf)

This presentation from [G√°bor Sz√°rnyas](https://www.linkedin.com/in/szarnyasg/) provides a lot of insights about in-process analytics using the power of DuckDB.

### [An Intro to DuckDB: The SQLite for Analytics](https://blog.det.life/an-intro-to-duckdb-the-sqlite-for-analytics-844a10e18454)

When, Why, and How You Should Consider Using DuckDB, according to [Karen Zhang](https://www.linkedin.com/in/yunying-karen-zhang/).

### [Building a modern data stack in a box using DuckDB, dbt, Meltano and Streamlit](https://blog.det.life/building-a-modern-data-stack-in-a-box-using-duckdb-dbt-meltano-and-streamlit-b427bb9869c3)

The modern data stack is evolving with time, but we know one thing for sure: DuckDB is part of it; and this article from Rahul Soni proves it.

### [A Modern Geospatial Workflow: PyEnv, Poetry, DuckDB, and JuPySQL](https://medium.com/@jake.gearon_34983/a-modern-geospatial-workflow-pyenv-poetry-duckdb-and-jupysql-7e7d355655f5)

More people are considering to use DuckDB for geospatial apps (and they should), and [Jake Gearon](https://www.linkedin.com/in/james-gearon-742767148/) shares an interesting example here.

### [Pandas v1 is dead, what's next ?](https://juhache.substack.com/p/pandas-v1-is-dead-whats-next?r=l9wvi)

The answer is obvious: DuckDB; according to [Julien Hurault](https://www.linkedin.com/in/julienhuraultanalytics/)

| ![Post asset](https://motherduck.com/_next/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2F22616816.fs1.hubspotusercontent-na1.net%2Fhubfs%2F22616816%2Fupcoming_events_graphic.png&w=3840&q=75) | ## Upcoming Events |

### [Airbyte move(data): Fixing the Data Engineering Lifecycle](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C1M74cdzX14)

**6 December 2023 \| Online üåê**

MotherDuck co-founder [Ryan Boyd](https://www.linkedin.com/in/ryguyrg/) will speak at the [Airbyte move(data) conference](https://movedata.airbyte.com/agenda?9e5d835f_page=2) on Fixing the data Engineering Lifecycle, a short talk based on his discussions with the community in preparation for the [panel at Coalesce with the same name](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W72K0cxTAtY).

### OpenD/I Summit:

**28th-30th November 2023 \| Online üåê**

This online conference will feature talks from leaders across Data, Cloud, Blockchain, AI, Web3. MotherDuck co-founder Ryan Boyd will present on "Data Analytics in the Post-Big-Data Era."

### [An abridged history of DuckDB: database tech from Amsterdam](https://datadaytexas.com/2024/sessions\#boncz)

**27 January 2024 \| Austin, Texas, USA üá∫üá∏**

In this session, [Peter Boncz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Boncz) will discuss the evolution of analytical database systems, starting from the classical relational database systems, all the way to DuckDB - the fastest growing data system today.
